41 
42 void swap(Reaction& left, Reaction& right) {
43  using std::swap;
44  swap(left.m_formula, right.m_formula);
45  swap(left.m_reactants, right.m_reactants);
46  swap(left.m_products, right.m_products);
47  swap(left.m_reversible, right.m_reversible);
48  swap(left.m_thirdbody, right.m_thirdbody);
49  swap(left.m_conserves, right.m_conserves);
50  swap(left.m_thirdbodies, right.m_thirdbodies);
51  swap(left.m_type, right.m_type);
52  swap(left.mp_rate, right.mp_rate);
53 }

55 //==============================================================================
56 
57 Reaction::Reaction(const IO::XmlElement& node, const class Thermodynamics& thermo)
58  : m_formula(""),
59  m_reversible(true),
60  m_thirdbody(false),
61  m_conserves(true),
62  mp_rate(NULL)
63 {
64  // Make sure this is a reaction type XML element
65  assert( node.tag() == "reaction" );
66 
67  // Store the reaction formula (must have)
68  node.getAttribute("formula", m_formula,
69  "No formula specied with reaction!");
70 
71  // Parse the formula to determine which species are involved, whether or
72  // not this is a third-body reaction, and reversibility of the reaction
73  parseFormula(node, thermo);
74 
75  // Now loop through the children of this node to determine the other
76  // attributes of the reaction
77  IO::XmlElement::const_iterator iter = node.begin();
78  for ( ; iter != node.end(); ++iter) {
79  if (iter->tag() == "arrhenius") {
80  mp_rate = new Arrhenius(*iter, order());
81  } else if (iter->tag() == "M") {
82  if (m_thirdbody) {
83  std::vector<std::string> tokens;
84  String::tokenize(iter->text(), tokens, ":, ");
85  for (int i = 0; i < tokens.size(); i+=2) {
86  int index = thermo.speciesIndex(tokens[i]);
87  if (index == 0 and thermo.hasElectrons()) {
88  iter->parseError(
89  "Electron cannot be a thirdbody species!");
90  }
91 
92  if (index >= 0) {
93  m_thirdbodies.push_back(
94  std::make_pair(index, atof(tokens[i+1].c_str())));
95  } else {
96  iter->parseError((
97  std::string("Thirdbody species ") + tokens[i] +
98  std::string(" is not in mixture list!")).c_str());
99  }
100  }
101  } else {
102  iter->parseError((
103  std::string("This reaction is not a thirdbody reaction") +
104  std::string(" but thirdbodies are given!")).c_str());
105  }
106  }
107  }
108 
109  // Make sure we got a RateLaw out of all that
110  if (mp_rate == NULL)
111  node.parseError("A rate law must be supplied with this reaction!");
112 
113  // Check for charge and mass conservation
114  const size_t ne = thermo.nElements();
115  int sums [ne];
116  std::fill(sums, sums+ne, 0.0);
117  for (int i = 0; i < nReactants(); ++i)
118  for (int k = 0; k < ne; ++k)
119  sums[k] += thermo.elementMatrix()(m_reactants[i],k);
120  for (int i = 0; i < nProducts(); ++i)
121  for (int k = 0; k < ne; ++k)
122  sums[k] -= thermo.elementMatrix()(m_products[i],k);
123  for (int i = 0; i < ne; ++i)
124  m_conserves &= (sums[i] == 0);
125 
126  // Figure out what type of reaction this is
127  determineType(thermo);
128 }
129 
130 //==============================================================================
131 
132 bool Reaction::operator == (const Reaction& r)
133 {
134  // Either both reactions are thirdbody or not
135  if (isThirdbody() == r.isThirdbody()) {
136  // A + B <=> AB = A + B <=> AB
137  // A + B => AB = A + B <=> AB
138  // A + B <=> AB = A + B => AB
139  // A + B => AB = A + B => AB
140  if (m_reactants == r.m_reactants &&
141  m_products == r.m_products)
142  return true;
143 
144  // A + B <=> AB = AB <=> A + B,
145  // A + B => AB = AB <=> A + B,
146  // A + B <=> AB = AB => A + B
147  if (m_reactants == r.m_products &&
148  m_products == r.m_reactants &&
149  !(isReversible() && r.isReversible()))
150  return true;
151  }
152 
153  // In the case where one reaction is thirdbody, we have to check if the non-
154  // thirdbody reaction is a special case of the thirdbody reaction
155  // (ie: N + O + M <=> NO + M (alpha_N != 0) and 2N + O <=> NO + N)
156 
157  return false;
158 }
159 
160 //==============================================================================
161 
162 void Reaction::parseFormula(
163  const IO::XmlElement& node, const class Thermodynamics& thermo)
164 {
165  // First step is to split the formula into reactant and product
166  // strings and determine reversibility of the reaction
167  size_t pos = m_formula.find("=");
168  if (pos == std::string::npos)
169  node.parseError((
170  std::string("Reaction formula ") + m_formula +
171  std::string(" does not have '=' or '=>'!")).c_str());
172 
173  std::string reactants = m_formula.substr(0, pos);
174  std::string products;
175 
176  if (m_formula[pos+1] == '>') {
177  m_reversible = false;
178  products = m_formula.substr(pos+2, m_formula.length()-pos-1);
179  } else {
180  m_reversible = true;
181  products = m_formula.substr(pos+1, m_formula.length()-pos);
182  }
183 
184  // Now that we have reactant and product strings, we can parse each
185  // separately using the same algorithm
186  parseSpecies(m_reactants, reactants, node, thermo);
187  parseSpecies(m_products, products, node, thermo);
188 }
189 
190 //==============================================================================
191 
192 void Reaction::parseSpecies(
193  std::vector<int>& species, std::string& str, const IO::XmlElement& node,
194  const class Thermodynamics& thermo)
195 {
196  // State-Machine states for parsing a species formula
197  enum ParseState {
198  coefficient,
199  name,
200  plus
201  } state = coefficient;
202 
203  size_t c = 0;
204  size_t s = 0;
205  size_t e = 0;
206  int nu = 1;
207  bool add_species = false;
208 
209  // Remove all spaces to simplify the state machine logic
210  String::eraseAll(str, " ");
211 
212  // Loop over every character
213  while (c != str.size()) {
214  // Decide what action to do
215  switch(state) {
216  case coefficient:
217  if (isdigit(str[c])) {
218  nu = atoi(str.substr(c,1).c_str());
219  s = c + 1;
220  } else {
221  nu = 1;
222  s = c;
223  }
224  state = name;
225  break;
226  case name:
227  if (str[c] == '+')
228  state = plus;
229  break;
230  case plus:
231  if (str[c] == '(') // Allow ionized STS: ie Ar+(0)
232  state = name;
233  else if (str[c] != '+') {
234  e = c - 2;
235  c--;
236  add_species = true;
237  state = coefficient;
238  }
239  break;
240  }
241 
242  // Add the last species which would not be counted because c will
243  // equal str.size() on the next iteration
244  if (c == str.size() - 1) {
245  add_species = true;
246  e = c;
247  }
248 
249  // If we found the start and end position of a species, add it to
250  // the list nu times (unless it is the special case of 'M')
251  if (add_species) {
252  if (str.substr(s,e-s+1) == "M") {
253  m_thirdbody = true;
254  } else {
255  int index = thermo.speciesIndex(str.substr(s,e-s+1));
256  if (index >= 0)
257  for (int i = 0; i < nu; ++i)
258  species.push_back(index);
259  else
260  node.parseError(("Species " + str.substr(s,e-s+1) +
261  " is not in the mixture list!").c_str());
262  }
263  add_species = false;
264  }
265 
266  // Move on to the next character
267  c++;
268  }
269 
270  // Sort the species vector
271  std::sort(species.begin(), species.end());
272 }
273 
274 //==============================================================================
275 
276 void Reaction::determineType(const class Thermodynamics& thermo)
277 {
278 
279  bool reactant_ion = false;
280  bool reactant_electron = false;
281  bool product_ion = false;
282  bool product_electron = false;
283  bool m_inert = isThirdbody();
284  bool m_inert_e = false;
285  int ecount = 0;
286  int chgcount = 0;
287 
288  // Check reactants for heavy ions and electrons
289  for (int i=0; i < nReactants(); ++i) {
290  const Species& species = thermo.species(m_reactants[i]);
291  if (species.type() == ELECTRON) {
292  ecount++;
293  reactant_electron = true;
294  } else if (species.isIon()) {
295  chgcount += abs(species.charge());
296  reactant_ion = true;
297  }
298  }
299 
300  // Check products
301  for (int i=0; i < nProducts(); ++i) {
302  const Species& species = thermo.species(m_products[i]);
303  if (species.type() == ELECTRON) {
304  ecount--;
305  product_electron = true;
306  } else if (species.isIon()) {
307  chgcount -= abs(species.charge());
308  product_ion = true;
309  }
310  }
311 
312  // Check for an inert species if not explicitly a thirdbody reaction
313  if (!m_inert) {
314  for (int i=0; i < nReactants(); ++i) {
315  for (int j=0; j < nProducts(); ++j) {
316  m_inert |= (m_reactants[i] == m_products[j]);
317  }
318  }
319  }
320 
321  // Is there an inert electron?
322  m_inert_e = (product_electron && reactant_electron);
323 
324  // ---------------- Logic tree ----------------
325  if (ecount > 0) {
326 
327  if (chgcount > 0) {
328  if (m_inert_e)
329  m_type = ION_RECOMBINATION_E;
330  else if (m_inert)
331  m_type = ION_RECOMBINATION_M;
332  else
333  m_type = DISSOCIATIVE_RECOMBINATION;
334 
335  } else {
336  if (m_inert_e)
337  m_type = ELECTRONIC_ATTACHMENT_E;
338  else if (m_inert)
339  m_type = ELECTRONIC_ATTACHMENT_M;
340  else
341  m_type = DISSOCIATIVE_ATTACHMENT;
342  }
343 
344  } else if (ecount < 0) {
345 
346  if (chgcount > 0) {
347  if (m_inert_e)
348  m_type = ELECTRONIC_DETACHMENT_E;
349  else if (m_inert)
350  m_type = ELECTRONIC_DETACHMENT_M;
351  else
352  m_type = ASSOCIATIVE_DETACHMENT;
353 
354  } else {
355  if (m_inert_e)
356  m_type = IONIZATION_E;
357  else if (m_inert)
358  m_type = IONIZATION_M;
359  else
360  m_type = ASSOCIATIVE_IONIZATION;
361  }
362 
363  } else {
364 
365  if (nReactants() > nProducts()) {
366  if (m_inert_e)
367  m_type = RECOMBINATION_E;
368  else
369  m_type = RECOMBINATION_M; // including double recombination
370 
371  } else if (nReactants() < nProducts()) {
372  if (m_inert_e)
373  m_type = DISSOCIATION_E;
374  else
375  m_type = DISSOCIATION_M; // including double dissociation
376 
377  } else {
378  if (m_inert_e)
379  m_type = EXCITATION_E;
380  else if (m_inert)
381  m_type = EXCITATION_M;
382  else
383  m_type = EXCHANGE; // exchange of charge, atom, or both simultaneously
384  }
385  }
386 }
387
